intro: Leucospermum album, commonly known as the white star flower, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its showy, white, star-shaped blooms. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, with woody stems and leathery, evergreen leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to Mediterranean climates. The flowers are pollinated by birds, particularly sunbirds, making it an important species for local ecosystems.
